post.text: Hillary Clinton is under FBI investigation AGAIN. She exposed America's most sensitive secrets, putting our national security at risk. Crooked is UNFIT to serve as our president. When I'm elected, I will PROTECT our people and our country! #AmericaFirst

comment.author: Kayla
comment.text: Just Who Is the Serial Liar - Donald Trump has said, repeatedly, that he opposed the war in Iraq from the start. He didn't. He said he saw "thousands" of Muslims celebrating on New Jersey rooftops on the night of Sept. 11, 2001. Didn't happen. He said that 58% of black youths are unemployed. Nope. These are far from isolated incidents. In fact, 63% of the 91 Trump statements that the WaPo's Fact Checker has checked were given a Four Pinocchio rating — meaning they were/are totally false. (A typical candidate gets Four Pinocchios somewhere between 10 and 20% of the time; 14.2% of Clinton's claims have been given Four Pinocchios.)In short: There is no doubt that even in the quadrennial truth-stretching that happens in presidential campaigns, Trump has set records for fabrication. Perception matters hugely in politics. What people perceive to be the facts — whether or not those actually are the facts — are very powerful when it comes to what they think of the presidential candidates. As much as many people hate to hear this, Trump's edge over Clinton on the honesty question is a classic example of perception mattering more than reality in our modern politics. There's simply no other explanation that makes any sense.

replies.author: Kayla
replies.text: Chase When the Polls Aren't Going Trump's Way, He Likes to Toss Them Aside by Declaring a "Silent Majority" of Americans will rise up on Election Day - or the Polls Are are Rigged. Boosting turnout among working class whites that support Trump to match their Hillary college-educated counterparts-- is a nearly incomprehensible 22-point jump in their participation--Trump would eek out a popular vote win of less than 500,000 votes, or roughly .3%. But under that scenario, Trump would only pick up two more swing states--Wisconsin and Iowa--and lose the electoral college, 245 to Clinton's 293, assuming other states broke as they did in 2012. Conclusion: Even under the best-case conditions for the Republican nominee, "an extraordinary turnout of white working class voters, by itself, cannot produce a Trump victory."

replies.author: Kayla
replies.text: Chase $50 Billionaire Michael Bloomberg Stung $10? Billionaire Donald Trump With a Brutal Critique - repeatedly skewered Trump's business practices. "I built a business, and I didn't start it with a million-dollar check from my father," the billionaire Bloomberg said, referring to the money Trump's father loaned him to start his first business. He added: "The richest thing about Donald Trump is his hypocrisy." Bloomberg said he understood the "appeal of a businessman" as president, but he contended that Trump would "make it harder for small businesses to compete" and would "do damage to our economy." "Trump is a risky, reckless, and radical choice, and we can't afford to make that choice," he said. "I am a New Yorker and New Yorker's know a con man when they see one" Bloomberg said, "New Yorkers don't think four bankruptcies are the sign of a good businessman."

replies.author: Kayla
replies.text: Chase Trump Supporter who shouted 'Jew-S-A!' at media is 'deplorable' - The rump supporter was wearing a "Hillary for Prison" T-shirt — began heckling the traveling press corps while Trump was speaking, turning his back on the candidate to glare at the media assembled inside the press pen. "You're going down! You're the enemy!" he shouted.Kellyanne Conway says the man who shouted "Jew-S-A!" at reporters covering the Republican nominee's rally in Phoenix on Saturday"

replies.author: Kayla
replies.text: Chase Donald Trump is Facing Multiple Charges of Defrauding Students at Trump University, one case with a Court date set for November 28, 2016. And there is more waiting for the Donald;www.theatlantic.com/...Donald Trump is facing a December 16, 2016 Court date in claims he raped a 13 year old girl. www.theguardian.com/... Donald Trump is the subject of multi-state investigations, uncovering fraud and self-dealing related to his Trump Foundation. www.washingtonpost.com/... Donald Trump has a history of thousands of lawsuits against him over his business practices, in which he bankrupted small businesses and cheated employees. ww.newsweek.com/... www.usatoday.com/... While even Donald Trump's tax proposals have been shown by bipartisan experts to benefit mainly Donald Trump and the ultra wealthy. www.forbes.com/... Donald Trump has a long and well-documented history of harassing and disrespecting women. www.vox.com/... And even Donald Trump's currently stated pro-life positions are both questionable and uninformed. www.vox.com/... While every major or minor "scandal" during Hillary Clinton's decades of public service has been thoroughly debunked. www.scarymommy.com/... On the other hand, the Republican Director of the FBI stated, unequivocally, in July 2016 that Hillary Clinton had not engaged in any criminal activity in the case involving her email server. However, now he says there are some additional emails that were not sent by Clinton, were not sent to Clinton, were never on her email server, may or may not have any significance to the email server investigation, and may have already been read by the FBI before July 2016 -- but some people believe this innuendo somehow disqualifies Clinton from the Presidency. Sorry, but innuendo and facts are not the same.
